DataElement.preferredName: Myeloproliferative Neoplasm Blast Count Greater Than Twenty Assessment Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A code that  represents the bone marrow of one or more of the myeloid (i.e., granulocytic, erythroid, megakaryocytic, and mast cell) lineages the number of blast cells blasts as a percentage of greater than 20  present in a blood sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorder, characterized by proliferation in the bone marrow of one or more of the myeloid (i.e., granulocytic, erythroid, megakaryocytic, and mast cell) lineages. It is primarily a neoplasm of adults. (WHO 2008)_The determination of the number of blast cells present in a blood sample._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Chronic myeloproliferative disorders (CMPDs) are clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorders, characterized by proliferation in the bone marrow of one or more of the myeloid (i.e., granulocytic, erythroid, and megakaryocytic) lineages.  The proliferation is associated with relatively normal, effective maturation, resulting in increased numbers of granulocytes, red blood cells, and/or platelets in the peripheral blood.  CMPDs are primarily diseases of adults.  -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A group of myeloid neoplasms that includes the following: chronic myeloid leukemia, BCR-ABL1 positive; polycythemia vera; essential thrombocythemia;  primary myelofibrosis; chronic neutrophilic leukemia; chronic eosinophilic leukemia, not otherwise specified; and myeloproliferative neoplasm, unclassifiable.

Property.preferredDefinition: The determination of the number of blast cells present in a blood sample.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the number of blast cells present in a biospecimen.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

It is primarily a neoplasm of adults. (WHO 2008)_A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.: Being or affecting only a part of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, including the absence of a detectable disease-related genetic abnormality, as determined by techniques such as karyotyping or FISH, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, including the absence of a detectable disease-related genetic abnormality, as determined by techniques such as karyotyping or FISH, in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What is the patient's disease
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the patient's disease response for this assessment per revised MPN criteria in section 11.2 table 1(if blasts greater than 20% at baseline)?
